meanings.definition: thewiest: superlative form of thew, meaning possessing strong and well-developed muscles
meanings.sent1: He was thewiest person in the gym, with muscles that could lift heavy weights easily.
meanings.sent2: The bodybuilder's thewiest feature was his well-defined biceps.
meanings.sent3: The superhero's thewiest power was his incredible strength, allowing him to save the day effortlessly.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was thewiest muscle she flexed, pushing her to achieve her fitness goals.
meanings.sent5: The lion's thewiest roar echoed through the jungle, showcasing its dominance.

meanings.definition: thewiest: comparative form of thew, meaning having stronger muscles than others
meanings.sent1: Among his friends, he was thewiest, always winning arm-wrestling competitions.
meanings.sent2: She felt thewiest after completing her intense workout, surpassing her previous strength levels.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was thewiest of its kind, able to climb higher and faster than the rest.
meanings.sent4: His determination made him thewiest competitor, never giving up in the face of challenges.
meanings.sent5: The mountain gorilla's thewiest display of power was when it effortlessly lifted a fallen tree.
